page.title: 01Knockholt? Cudham? Or?
page.content: This area covers parts of the parishes of Brasted, Chevening, Sundridge, Cudham and Knockholt, but no centre of population. As it contains Knockholt Church and School we will refer to it as Knockholt. Administratively it is shared between the London Borough of Bromley and Kent County Council. The M25 and A233 cut across the southern corners, the M25 is often audible. There are two pubs and a very limited bus service. At the highest point there are wireless aerials for the Police and Thames Water Authority and a covered reservoir. The population of about 500 is almost exclusively white English and mainly professional. There are about 200 houses. Several people have lived here all their lives. House prices keep most young people out. Few people retire into the area though many stay here when they retire.
